definition: to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

sentences.english: Among the punishments are potential fines or the threat of being replaced with another elector.
sentences.chinese: 其中的惩罚可能就是罚款或者是被革职的风险。

sentences.english: He has sued on the ground of being dismissed without any reason.
sentences.chinese: 他已经以无故被革职为由提出了诉讼。

sentences.english: A handful of railway officials have been dismissed from their posts.
sentences.chinese: 多名铁路官员已被革职。

sentences.english: Workers were sacked left and right. Many restaurants in the old industrial districts went bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 员工被革职的无数，不少旧工业区的食肆破产。

definition: to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
(of an official) to lose one's job
to accuse of misconduct (in official task)/to impeach
